summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney and a court clerk regarding the submission of exhibits for a signed search warrant affidavit in the Epstein case. The AUSA attaches four exhibits to ensure they are maintained in the court's file.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email who attaches four exhibits to a signed search warrant affidavit to ensure they are maintained in the court's file.

events.title: Submission of Warrant Exhibits
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails a court clerk to attach four exhibits to a previously submitted signed search warrant affidavit to ensure they are maintained in the court's file.

locations: United States District Court of New York
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated October 29, 2020, regarding the Epstein case.
An Assistant United States Attorney is submitting four exhibits to accompany a signed search warrant affidavit.
The exhibits include documents such as a June 2020 Warrant, a Maxwell Superseding Indictment, and a July 2019 Warrant.
The purpose is to ensure the exhibits are maintained in the court's file.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings related to the Epstein case in late 2020.
